abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental and social impact
            study for the Emergency Recovery and Community Support
            Project for the Republic of Congo identifies negative
            environmental impacts and proposes measures to mitigate them
            For the project components of local investment priorities,
            rural road construction, water supply and sanitation, and
            support to community organizations (nongovernmental
            organizations), micro-projects may cover these activities:
            constructing schools, markets, and social centers; extending
            electrification networks; rehabilitating pathways leading to
            agricultural markets, tourist centers, providing water
            supply infrastructure, building embankments, providing fish
            to develop aquaculture, and harnessing solar energy, among
            them. Negative impacts that may result include
            deforestation, soil erosion, destruction of animal habitats,
            sedimentation, runoff, water body pollution from chemicals
            and fertilizer overuse, disruption of water flow; air
            pollution from dust and gas emissions, pollution from
            worksite waste, noise, traffic congestion, accident risks
            among workers and traffic accidents involving residents and
            animals crossing the site, farmland degradation,
            encroachment, poaching, increase in prostitution and moral
            depravity, transmission of infectious diseases-particularly
            HIV/AIDS, child labor, unauthorized exploitation of forest
            resources and poaching in protected areas, water-borne
            diseases, social conflicts, resource overexploitation,
            disturbance of cultural heritage sites, risk of substitution
            of local species by exotic species, and the use of
            pesticides leading to water table pollution, animal
            contamination, food contamination, and packaging
            mismanagement, among other impacts.
